We have proven track record in creating profitable, high-performance brands in the fruit business and are committed to building sustainable, competitive and high-performing companies. We allways put our customers first. We offer a wealth of service at affordable prices, and we have a team of experts in the fields of business web development and consulting. Our experience helps us to identify business opportunities that our customers may not have time or expertise in.test tg

title: NJDMV - Motor Vehicle Commission - Knowledge Test Quiz 1

contents:
Next Open In Quiz Mode Previous 1. A triangular shaped sign is a: A. yield sign B. warning sign C. railroad sign D. stop sign Answer : A. yield sign
2. A holder of a student permit must have the following with them while driving: A. Adult supervising driver in the front Seat B. Their student permit C. Registration and insurance ID card D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
3. Effective July 1, 2004, motorists in New Jersey may not use a hand-held wireless telephone while driving except for the following instances: A. Fire B. Traffic accidents C. Medical emergency D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
4. When approaching or nearing an uncontrolled intersection you should: A. speed up to clear intersection quickly B. slow down and look straight ahead C. reduce speed and be ready to stop D. Always come to a full stop Answer : C. reduce speed and be ready to stop
5. When the pavement is marked with 2 centerlines, 1 solid and 1 broken: A. passing is permitted only on the side with the broken line B. passing is permitted on either side C. passing is permitted on both sides, but only when the road is clear D. passing is not permitted on either side Answer : A. passing is permitted only on the side with the broken line
6. Road surfaces are most slippery: A. during very hot, humid weather B. during very cold, dry weather C. After a very heavy rainfall D. during the first few minutes of a rainfall Answer : D. during the first few minutes of a rainfall
7. New Jersey law allows up to 3 points to be subtracted from your driving record if you have no moving traffic violation: A. for 2 years from the date of the last violation B. for 6 months from the date of the last violation C. for 1 year from the date of the last violation D. for 18 months from the date of the last violation Answer : C. for 1 year from the date of the last violation
8. If the driver of a large truck or bus cannot see you in his rearview mirrors, you are: A. in the truck’s no-zone or blind spot B. Driving to slowly C. Uninteresting to him D. driving a compact car Answer : A. in the truck’s no-zone or blind spot
9. A single, solid white line across a road at an intersection means A. no parking zone B. bus stop C. no passing D. stop behind the line for a traffic sign or light Answer : D. stop behind the line for a traffic sign or light
10. The best way to take a curve is: A. speed up while in the curve B. lean in the direction of the curve C. slow down before entering the curve D. slow down after entering the curve Answer : C. slow down before entering the curve
11. When nearing a steady yellow or amber traffic signal, you should A. stop immediately, do not continue through the intersection B. slow down and continue with caution through the intersection C. stop before entering the intersection, if you can safely do so D. speed up and continue through the intersection before the light changes to red Answer : C. stop before entering the intersection, if you can safely do so
12. A twelve-ounce can of beer has as much alcohol in it as: A. A bottle of rum B. 2 martinis C. 1 1⁄2 ounces of 86 proof whiskey D. A pint of brandy Answer : C. 1 1⁄2 ounces of 86 proof whiskey
13. When approaching a railroad crossing with flashing lights you must: A. stop at the crossing B. slow down and look both ways C. slow down, blow your horn and proceed with caution D. All of the above Answer : A. stop at the crossing
14. To safely share the road with large trucks and buses, you must know: A. The horsepower rating of your vehicle. B. The history of the trucking industry. C. Limitations of these vehicles regarding visibility, stopping distances required and maneuverability. D. The impact trucks and large vehicles have on the environment. Answer : C. Limitations of these vehicles regarding visibility, stopping distances required and maneuverability.
15. Getting a drivers license illegally may result in: A. imprisonment of 6 months B. A fine of $200 to $500 and/or imprisonment of 30-90 days C. A court trial D. A fine of $25 to $l00 Answer : B. A fine of $200 to $500 and/or imprisonment of 30-90 days
16. In adverse weather conditions, a truck takes longer to stop. This can be as much as: A. 70% more B. 25% more C. 50% more D. 100% more Answer : B. 25% more
17. If under 21, New Jersey law states that you may be under the influence if your blood alcohol level content is A. More than .10% but less than .15% B. More than .05% but less than .10% C. More than .01% but less than .05% D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
18. A supervising driver for the holder of a validated GDL Permit must meet which of the following requirements: A. Must be 21 years or older B. Must be a New Jersey licensed driver C. Must be licensed for a minimum of 3 years D. A, B, and C Answer : D. A, B, and C
19. The holder of a validated GDL permit (21 years of age or older) is restricted to what driving hours? A. 6:01AM to midnight B. No restrictions apply C. 5:01AM to midnight D. 5:01AM to 11:00PM Answer : B. No restrictions apply
20. The holder of a validated GDL Special Learner’s permit must not drive between the hours of: A. 11:01PM and 6:00AM B. 11:01PM and 5:00AM C. No restrictions apply D. 12:01AM and 5:00AM Answer : B. 11:01PM and 5:00AM
Next Open In Quiz Mode Previous
title: NJDMV - Motor Vehicle Commission - Knowledge Test Questions 1 to 20

contents:
Next Open In Quiz Mode Previous 101. If not prohibited by a “no turn on red sign”, New Jersey law permits you to turn right on red after: A. making a full stop and checking traffic B. blowing your horn C. slowing down to check traffic D. checking traffic to your right Answer : A. making a full stop and checking traffic
102. Which of the following convictions will result in an Insurance Surcharge: A. Operating Under the Influence of Liquor/Drugs B. Operating Under the Influence of Liquor/Drugs and Refusal to Take a Breathalyzer Test C. Refusal to Take a Breathalyzer Test D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
103. A motorist will be subject to the following for a conviction of a 3rd violation of Operation Under the Influence of Liquor/Drugs: A. Installation of interlock device OR suspension of all vehicle registrations B. Installation of interlock device AND suspension of all vehicle registrations C. Suspension of driving privilege D. A and C Answer : C. Suspension of driving privilege
104. Before turning, you must signal at least: A. 500 feet in advance B. 100 feet in advance C. 100 yards in advance D. 1 block in advance Answer : B. 100 feet in advance
105. An eight-sided sign means: A. yield to other traffic B. stop C. slow down D. railroad crossing Answer : B. stop
106. If you miss your exit on an expressway you should: A. go on to the next exit B. slow down and stop C. turn around and go back D. pull off the road and back up the shoulder Answer : A. go on to the next exit
107. It is a good practice to keep a space cushion to: A. give you time to react B. give you a clear view of the road C. decrease your reaction time D. none of the above Answer : A. give you time to react
108. When driving at night, be sure that you can stop: A. within 20 feet at all times B. within 20 feet at 30 miles per hour C. within 20 feet at 40 miles per hour D. within the distance you can see ahead Answer : D. within the distance you can see ahead
109. When passing a large truck or bus, it is important to remember: A. The name of the owner or business printed on the side of the truck. B. There are several no-zones (blind spots) in which the driver cannot see you. C. What the “two-second” rule is. D. All of the above. Answer : B. There are several no-zones (blind spots) in which the driver cannot see you.
110. When your license is returned to you after suspension for points (or after completing a DMV Driver Improvement Program, you will be on probation for: A. two years B. one year C. 6 months D. 9 months Answer : B. one year
111. One and one-half ounces of 86 proof whiskey contains the same amount of alcohol as: A. a 6-pack of beer B. 6 ounces of premium beer C. a bottle of wine D. 12 ounces of beer Answer : D. 12 ounces of beer
112. By law, you are under the influence when the amount of alcohol in your blood or BAC has reached: A. .01% B. .05% C. .08% D. none of the above Answer : C. .08%
113. Under GDL Law, a person is required to attend a remedial training class for the following: A. Accumulation of 4 or more points B. Accumulation of 2 or more points C. Conviction of a DUI D. A and C Answer : D. A and C
114. Implied Consent Law means: A. you must have liability insurance B. you sign an agreement to give blood C. permission for another to move your car in emergencies D. when you drive a motor vehicle, you automatically agree to take a breath test following an arrest for a suspected drinking and driving offense Answer : D. when you drive a motor vehicle, you automatically agree to take a breath test following an arrest for a suspected drinking and driving offense
115. Every vehicle registered in New Jersey must be insured for: A. theft B. fire damage C. liability D. collision Answer : C. liability
116. You may pass on the right when: A. the driver ahead is turning left and there is a proper lane on the right B. there are no traffic signals C. entering an intersection D. there is a slow moving vehicle ahead Answer : A. the driver ahead is turning left and there is a proper lane on the right
118. The holder of a Provisional Driver License, under 21 years of age, is permitted to have how many non-household members in the car? A. 0 B. 1 C. 2 D. 3 or more Answer : B. 1
119. After two to four drinks, alcohol begins to impair your: A. reaction time B. coordination and balance C. judgment D. all of the above Answer : D. all of the above
120. Any change of address must be reported to the Division of Motor Vehicle Services within what time period? A. 1 week B. 6 weeks C. 2 months D. 2 weeks Answer : A. 1 week Next Open In Quiz Mode Previous
title: NJDMV - Motor Vehicle Commission - Knowledge Test Questions 101 to 120

contents:
Next Open In Quiz Mode Previous 121. To maintain a proper following distance when driving, you should stay at least: A. 3/4 of a second behind the vehicle in front of you B. 1/2 of a second behind the vehicle in front of you C. 2 seconds behind the vehicle in front of you D. 1 second behind the vehicle in front of you Answer : C. 2 seconds behind the vehicle in front of you
122. If a student driver commits a traffic offense, responsibility will be with: A. neither student nor instructor B. only the student C. only the instructor D. both student and instructor Answer : D. both student and instructor
Next Open In Quiz Mode Previous
title: NJDMV - Motor Vehicle Commission - Knowledge Test Questions 121 to 140

contents:
Next Open In Quiz Mode Previous 21. New Jersey law requires that a child must be seated in a child restraint device while riding in a car if: A. The child is under 5 years of age and riding in the front seat B. The child is under 18 months of age and is riding in the front seat C. The child is under 18 months of age and is riding in the back seat D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
22. You may not park within how many feet of a fire hydrant? A. 50 feet B. 25 feet C. 20 feet D. 10 feet Answer : D. 10 feet
23. How many passengers may accompany the holder of a validated GDL Special Learners Permit in the vehicle? A. 0 B. Any passengers from their shared residence plus 1 additional person. C. 2 D. None of the above. Answer : B. Any passengers from their shared residence plus 1 additional person.
24. In city driving, a good habit is to: A. use the 2 second rule B. reduce speed and use horn C. look 12 seconds ahead D. practice good judgment Answer : C. look 12 seconds ahead
25. The “2 second rule” can be used at any speed to help you: A. drive within the speed limit B. bring your car out of a skid C. Time traffic lights at intersections D. keep a safe following distance Answer : D. keep a safe following distance
26. If you drink and have reached a BAC of slightly above .05%, the risk of your causing a motor vehicle accident is: A. no different B. Triple C. double D. none of the above Answer : C. double
27. If you approach an intersection and a large truck is stopped for the traffic light, you should: A. Blow your horn so the driver will know you are there. B. Go around the truck on the right because he will startup slower. C. Stop with enough distance so you will not be in a blind spot and you can see the driver in hismirror. D. Stop as close to the rear of the truck as possible so no one can get in front of you. Answer : C. Stop with enough distance so you will not be in a blind spot and you can see the driver in hismirror.
28. When it is legal to turn right on red, before turning, you must: A. slow down and check traffic B. make a full stop and check traffic C. blow your horn D. check traffic to right Answer : B. make a full stop and check traffic
29. If you drink beyond a SAC of .05%, the risk of your causing a motor vehicle accident doubles and at. 10% the risk increases to: A. 4 times as great B. 10 times as great C. 6 times as great D. 3 times as great Answer : C. 6 times as great
30. If a person has been drinking, which of the following can sober them up? A. fresh air B. drinking strong black coffee C. Time D. A cold shower Answer : C. Time
31. The best way to “talk” to other drivers on the road is to: A. be courteous and wave B. use your horn and lights C. roll down your window and yell D. All of the above Answer : B. use your horn and lights
32. If you sell your car (and do not buy another) what should you do with the license plates? A. give them to a friend to use B. keep them as a souvenir C. Turn them into a Motor Vehicle inspection facility D. Throw them away Answer : C. Turn them into a Motor Vehicle inspection facility
33. In city driving you should: A. drive more slowly B. watch for pedestrians C. look at least 12 seconds ahead D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
34. The holder of a Provisional Driver License is not permitted use of which of the following while driving: A. Hand held electronic devices B. Hand held video game C. Cell phones D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
35. The holder of a Provisional License, who is under the age of 21, may drive unsupervised when the following requirement is met: A. 6 months of supervised driving B. Pass a road test C. Pass a road test after 6 months of supervised driving, excluding any suspensions or postponements D. Pass a road test after 6 months of supervised driving Answer : C. Pass a road test after 6 months of supervised driving, excluding any suspensions or postponements
36. You should always yield to: A. emergency vehicles B. pedestrians C. Other vehicles already in the intersection D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
37. In New Jersey, studded snow tires can be legally used between: A. September 30th and May 30th B. October 15th and March 15th C. April 1st and December 15th D. November 15th and April 1st Answer : D. November 15th and April 1st
38. When parking uphill on a Street with a curb on your right, your car wheels should be: A. Turned away from the curb B. Turned straight ahead C. Turned to the right D. Turned toward the curb Answer : A. Turned away from the curb
39. Altering a driver’s license, or showing an altered driver’s license, may result in A. A fine of up to $1000 B. up to 6 months imprisonment C. loss of your driving privilege D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
40. The driving hours of a GDL Examination Permit or Provisional License (under 21 years of age) are restricted to: A. 5:01AM to 11:00PM B. 5:01 AM to midnight C. 6:01 AM to midnight D. No restrictions apply Answer : B. 5:01 AM to midnight
Next Open In Quiz Mode Previous
title: NJDMV - Motor Vehicle Commission - Knowledge Test Questions 21 to 40

contents:
Next Open In Quiz Mode Previous 41. If a person gets drunk in your home and has a motor vehicle accident after leaving your home,you could: A. be charged with a crime B. not be held responsible C. become involved in a lawsuit D. none of the above Answer : C. become involved in a lawsuit
42. A provisional driver is provisional for how long? A. 4 years B. l year C. 6 months D. 3 months Answer : B. l year
43. When parking downhill on a street with a curb on your right, your car wheels should be: A. Turned away from the curb B. Turned straight ahead C. Turned toward the curb D. Turned to the left Answer : C. Turned toward the curb
44. You cannot park: A. in front of a fire hydrant B. in a bus stop C. in front of a driveway D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
45. Double solid lines in the center of a 2-way road means: A. Traffic should not cross from either side B. “pass with care” road C. A 1-way Street D. A divided highway Answer : A. Traffic should not cross from either side
46. A person may operate a Moped with: A. A valid basic license B. A valid motorcycle license C. A valid moped license D. Any of the above Answer : D. Any of the above
47. Emotions can have a great effect on your driving; if you are angry or excited you should: A. give yourself time to cool off B. blow your horn to warn other drivers C. drive with your radio on D. none of the above Answer : A. give yourself time to cool off
48. The best way to reduce your chances of having an alcohol related accident is to: A. not drive at all after drinking B. know your own limits C. reduce your drinking D. have a meal before drinking Answer : A. not drive at all after drinking
49. When making a left turn from a two-way road onto a 4 lane highway, the proper way to turn is: A. Approach the turn as close to the centerline of the road as possible B. make the turn before reaching the center of the intersection C. Turn into the left lane of the road going in your direction D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
50. If you go into a skid you should: A. Take your foot off the gas pedal B. straighten your wheels C. Apply your brakes D. make a fast turn Answer : A. Take your foot off the gas pedal
51. A Railroad Crossing Sign is: A. Black and Red (Triangle) B. White and Blue (Square) C. Black and Yellow (Circle) D. Green and White (Diamond) Answer : C. Black and Yellow (Circle)
52. When sharing the road with large trucks or buses, you should: A. Give more roadway to a truck making a wide turn. B. Leave more space when stopping behind a truck or bus. C. Maintain a consistent speed when passing. D. All of the above. Answer : D. All of the above.
53. If your wheels drift onto the dirt shoulder of the road and you want to return to the paved road, you should: A. drive along the shoulder until you get to an acceleration lane B. drive along the shoulder until you are going as fast as the traffic on the road C. move slowly along shoulder and wave traffic around you D. slow down, turn back onto the pavement slowly Answer :
54. At the time of your Road Test, you must present A. a valid vehicle registration B. a valid examination permit C. a valid insurance I4. D. Card D. all of the above Answer : D. All of the above
55. A green light means: A. be ready to stop B. slow down C. slow before an intersection D. go when safe Answer : D. go when safe
56. If you have a flat tire or blowout you should: A. grip the wheel firmly B. letup on the gas pedal C. let car coast to a stop D. all of the above Answer : D. All of the above
57. When driving around a curve, your vehicle may tend to: A. keep going straight B. slow down C. follow the curve D. speed up Answer : A. keep going straight
58. When approaching a railroad crossing with flashing lights you must: A. stop at the crossing B. slow down and look both ways C. slow down, blow your horn and proceed with caution D. all of the above Answer : A. stop at the crossing
59. Dim your lights to low beam when: A. driving on dark roads B. parking on an unlit highway C. entering a curve D. a car is approaching you or when you are behind another car Answer : D. a car is approaching you or when you are behind another car
60. Any change of address must be reported to the Motor Vehicle Commission within what time period? A. 1 week B. 6 weeks C. 2 months D. 2 weeks Answer : A. 1 week
Next Open In Quiz Mode Previous
title: NJDMV - Motor Vehicle Commission - Knowledge Test Questions 41 to 60

contents:
Next Open In Quiz Mode Previous 61. To avoid highway hypnosis when driving on an expressway, it is a good practice to: A. look straight ahead to the side B. spend as much time looking at your mirrors as you do looking in front of you C. rest yours eyes by slowly blinking them from time to time D. avoid looking at any one thing for more than a few seconds Answer : D. avoid looking at any one thing for more than a few seconds
62. Hydroplaning is a driving condition wherein tires lose traction on a wet road and float on a layer of water or slush; when this happens, you should A. push the brake pedal down hard B. increase speed C. change lanes D. slow down Answer : D. slow down
63. When you move into New Jersey from another state, you must have your vehicle inspected within: A. 90 days after registering it B. 2 months after registering it C. 6 months after registering it D. 14 days after registering it Answer : D. 14 days after registering it
64. Police cars, fire trucks, ambulances, volunteer fire and rescue squad members responding to emergencies use sirens and red or blue flashing lights. When you see or hear them, you must: A. speed up and stay at least 100 feet ahead of them B. slow up and let them pass you C. pull over to the extreme right of roadway and stop, letting them pass you D. follow them and offer assistance Answer : C. pull over to the extreme right of roadway and stop, letting them pass you
65. You can reduce your chances of being involved in an accident by knowing and using the standard accident prevention formula: A. be alert B. be prepared C. act in time D. all of the above Answer : D. all of the above
66. The holder of a validated GDL Student Learner’s Permit must meet which of the following requirements to obtain a Provisional License: A. Pass road test B. Attain 17 years of age C. 6 month minimum of supervised driving D. A, B and C Answer : D. A, B and C
67. The speed limit in a school zone, unless otherwise posted, is: A. 25 m.p.h. B. 15 m.p.h. C. 10 m.p.h. D. 35 m.p.h. Answer : A. 25 m.p.h.
68. The holder of a validated GDL Examination Permit (21 years of age or older) is required to drive with supervision for a: A. Minimum of 6 months B. Minimum of 9 months C. Minimum of 3 months D. No supervision is required Answer : B. Minimum of 9 months
69. New Jersey law states that if you are 21 or over you may or may not be under the influence if your blood alcohol content is: A. more than .10% but less than .15% B. more than .15% but less than .20% C. more than .05% but less than .08% D. all of the above Answer : C. more than .05% but less than .08%
70. The shape of a yield sign is: A. circle in square B. triangle C. eight-sided D. diamond Answer : B. triangle
71. Signals should be used: A. when changing lanes B. when turning C. when slowing down D. all of the above Answer : D. all of the above
72. On a two-lane road not near a school when a school bus is stopped and its red lights are flashing: A. you must stop B. you may pass the bus with caution C. you may pass the bus from either direction D. you may pass the bus at a speed of 10 mph. or less Answer : A. you must stop
73. If you have a tire blowout: A. apply your brakes B. continue at regular speed until it is safe to slow down C. slow down gradually D. turn off the road quickly Answer : C. slow down gradually
74. Laws of New Jersey require you to keep to the right except: A. when impractical to travel on that side of the roadway B. when passing C. when on a one-way street D. all of the above Answer : D. all of the above
75. At what age is the holder of a GDL Special Learner’s Permit eligible to obtain a basic driver license? A. 17, with passing the road test B. 18 C. 18, with completion of Provisional requirements D. 17, with one year of supervised driving and passing the road test Answer : C. 18, with completion of Provisional requirements
76. A provisional driver, during daylight hours when raining, must have A. Wipers on B. Headlights on C. Both A & B D. Defrosters only Answer : C. Both A & B
77. A diamond shaped sign is a: A. yield sign B. stop sign C. warning sign D. railroad sign Answer : C. warning sign
78. A deceleration lane is: A. the passing lane B. an extra lane at a highway exit C. for slow drivers only D. for fast drivers only Answer : B. an extra lane at a highway exit
79. When 2 roads intersect and there are no signs or signals, it is a good practice to: A. blow your horn as a warning B. be ready to stop if necessary C. pull to the right hand lane and stop D. always yield to traffic on the left Answer : B. be ready to stop if necessary
80. On a two-lane road, not near a school, when a school bus is stopped and its red lights are flashing: A. you must stop B. you may pass the bus from either direction C. you may pass the bus at a speed of 10 m.p.h. or less D. you may pass the bus with caution Answer : A. you must stop

In the event of a crash or sudden stop, use of seat belts may: A. keep you from being thrown from the car B. keep you from hitting the windshield or dashboard C. keep you from sliding off the seat and losing control of the car D. all of the above Answer : D. all of the above
82. Driving while under the influence of intoxicating beverages means: A. your senses or judgment are impaired by alcohol B. drinking while in process of driving the vehicle C. the driver shows obvious signs of being drunk D. driving even if the driver has had one drink Answer : A. your senses or judgment are impaired by alcohol
83. Studies show that the greatest number of people arrested for drunk driving have been drinking: A. beer B. whiskey C. wine D. mixed drinks Answer : A. beer
84. If a vehicle is passing you, you should A. slow down to make it easier for the driver to complete the pass in time B. flash your lights and sound your horn to warn the car passing that it is unsafe C. continue at the same speed and signal oncoming traffic D. speed up so he will not complete the pass Answer : A. slow down to make it easier for the driver to complete the pass in time
85. If you are under 21 years of age and drive a vehicle with as little as 0.01% blood alcohol concentration, you are subject to a penalty of: A. 30 to 90 day driver license suspension. B. 15 to 30 days community service. C. participation in an intoxicated driver resource center or other alcohol education highway safety program. D. all of the above. Answer : D. all of the above.
86. The meaning of a hand-signal when a driver’s hand and arm are upward is: A. U-Turn B. Slow-Stop C. Left-Turn D. Right-Turn Answer : D. Right-Turn
87. Who is required by the GDL law to wear a seat belt in the vehicle? A. The driver and all passengers B. The driver and front seat passenger C. The driver and supervising driver D. The driver Answer : A. The driver and all passengers
88. You should always yield to: A. emergency vehicles B. pedestrians C. other vehicles already in the intersection D. all of the above Answer : D. all of the above
89. Which of the following drinks contain the highest alcohol content? A. 5 ounces of table wine B. 1 1⁄2 ounces of whiskey C. 12 ounces of beer D. all of the above are about equal in content Answer : D. all of the above are about equal in content
25. The New Jersey speed limit in a business or residential area, unless otherwise posted, is: A. 30 m.p.h. B. 25 m.p.h. C. 20 m.p.h. D. 35 m.p.h. Answer : B. 25 m.p.h.
90. To regain control while in a skid, you should: A. keep a tight grip on the steering wheel B. turn in the same direction the back of the car is skidding C. turn in the opposite direction the back of the car is skidding D. make a fast turn in the direction of the skid and lock the brakes Answer : B. turn in the same direction the back of the car is skidding
91. You can not take your road test in a vehicle with any obstructions or consoles between the driver and the examiner because: A. examiner cannot reach the brakes B. obstruction is illegal C. console takes up too much space D. examiner cannot observe your feet Answer : A. examiner cannot reach the brakes
92. Effective July 1, 2004, motorist in New Jersey may not use a hand-held wireless telephone while driving except for the following instances: A. Fire B. Traffic accidents C. Medical emergency D. All of the above Answer : D. All of the above
93. The order of colors on a traffic light hung top to bottom: A. red, yellow, green B. red, green, yellow C. green, yellow, green D. yellow, green, red Answer : A. red, yellow, green
94. High beam lights are used for: A. city streets without lamps B. signaling emergencies C. foggy weather D. open country driving Answer : D. open country driving
95. The holder of a Provisional Driver License, under 21 years if age, is permitted to have how many non-household members in the car? A. 3 or more B. 2 C. 1 D. 0 Answer : C. 1
96. You cannot park within how many feet of a crosswalk at an intersection? A. 25 feet B. 10 feet C. 20 feet D. 50 feet Answer : A. 25 feet
97. When making a left turn from a two-way road, you should get close to the: A. line nearest to the center of the road B. left lane nearest to the left curb C. right lane, or the lane furthest from the center lane D. right lane, or the lane nearest to the right curb Answer : A. line nearest to the center of the road
98. How much is the fine for violation of any of the conditions of the GDL Permits or Provisional License? A. No fine. B. $500.00 C. $100.00 D. $250.00 Answer : C. $100.00
99. The meaning of a hand signal when a driver’s hand and arm are downward is: A. Right-turn B. U-turn C. Left-turn D. Slow or stop Answer : D. Slow or stop
100. Whether your blood alcohol content rises above legal limits depends on: A. amount you drink B. your weight C. time you take to drink D. all of the above Answer : D. all of the above

contents: Strikes the upper surface of the impenetrable foliage of my trees, and but a few stray gleams steal into the inner sanctuary, I throw myself down among the tall grass by the trickling stream and, as I lie close to the earth, a thousand unknown plants are noticed by me.When I hear the buzz of the little world among the stalks, and grow familiar with the countless indescribable forms of the insects and flies, then I feel the presence of the Almighty, who formed us in his own image, and the breath of that universal love which bears and sustains.
